alert.note: Alert for Hardeman; Shelby (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 31 at 11:19PM CDT until April 01 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of North Mississippi and West Tennessee, including the following counties, in North Mississippi, Benton, DeSoto and Marshall. In West Tennessee, Fayette, Hardeman and Shelby. * WHEN...Until 200 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1119 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southaven, Collierville, Germantown, Olive Branch, Horn Lake, Hernando, Bolivar, Cordova, T O Fuller State Park, Memphis, Whiteville, Somerville, Byhalia, Walls, Mt Pleasant, Slayden, Eads, Michigan City, Lagrange and Lewisburg. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
